business.headline: Old or New Tax Regime: Here's how to pick the right one before filing ITRUnder the old tax regime, taxpayers can claim various deductions and exemptions, while the new tax regime does not offer much deductions.

ITR filing: How is tax refund calculated, and when will you get it?When you file your return, you declare your income, claim deductions, and report taxes already paid. The tax system compares your actual tax due with what you've already paid. If you've paid more, the extra amount is returned to you as a refund.
Wipro Q4 results: Net profit rises 26% to Rs 3,570 croreRevenue from operations saw a modest 1% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 22,504 crore, compared to Rs 22,208 crore in Q4FY24.
Sensex closes 300 points higher, Nifty above 23,400; banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex added 309.40 points to close at 77,044.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.65 points to end at 23,437.20.

Inside Gensol's loan fraud: The fake documents used to hide debtSebi found that when the credit rating agencies asked Gensol to share term loan statements from all its lenders, the company shared documents for most lenders, except for IREDA and PFC.

White House fact sheet sparks confusion about 245% tariff on ChinaWhile a White House fact sheet mentions that China now faces up to 245% tariffs, the usual brouhaha by Donald Trump while making such announcements was missing.

Who are Gensol's promoters Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi?According to Sebi's findings, both Anmol and Puneet are accused of misusing company funds. The market regulator claims that the promoters treated the company like their personal business.
Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares jumped 6% todayShares of IndusInd Bank were trading 5.51% higher at Rs 776.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) around 12:34 pm.

Over 3 million iPhones sold: Apple likely to post best-ever quarter in IndiaThe Q1 2025 number is a big jump from the 2.21 million iPhones sold in the same period last year. It shows how fast Apple is growing in India, a market that is becoming more important for the company every year.

Investment advisor warns against inflation: 'By 2030, you'll own less, pay more'Abhijit Chokshi stated in his post that most people think inflation means things getting expensive. But he explains that inflation has two faces. One is visible inflation and the other is invisible inflation.

PwC shuts down operations in more than a dozen countries: ReportThe decision was taken due to mounting differences with local partners. Local leaders at the firm said they lost over a third of their business in recent years after pressure from PwC's global executives to drop risky clients.

How Gensol promoter used company funds to buy ultra-luxury DLF Camellias flatDLF Camellias is a luxury housing project located in Sector 42, Gurgaon. It comprises 4 BHK, 5 BHK, and 6 BHK luxury apartments. Prices for these upscale homes begin at Rs 70 crore.
IREDA share price jumps 6% after strong Q4 results. All you need to knowIREDA shares jumped sharply after strong Q4 earnings, though asset quality concerns could temper gains in the near term.

Gensol Engineering share price crashes to all-time low. Should you buy or avoid?The stock has now crashed 84% since the start of 2025 and is down nearly 87% over the past year, making it one of the worst-performing listed firms in the clean energy space.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after 2-day tariff relief rally; Gensol shares tumble 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 84.98 points to 76,649.91 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.25 points to trade at 23,302.30. However, broader market indices did not see any major dip, and it is likely to provide relief to retail investors.
Gensol Engineering shares in focus today as Sebi takes action against promotersGensol Engineering shares have plunged 83% this year, and the market regulator's interim order may deepen the sell-off.

Sebi vs Jaggi brothers: What's in the interim order over wrongdoings?During its probe, the market regulator found 'blatant violation of rules of corporate governance' and 'alleged wrongdoings'.  It said that the promoters were running Gensol like a private firm.

Sebi bans Gensol's Jaggi brothers for diverting company funds for personal useSebi has passed an interim order barring promoters Anmol Singh Jaggi and Puneet Singh Jaggi from taking part in the securities market and from holding any position as directors or key managerial personnel in any listed company.

Government, Swiggy join hands to boost jobs in gig, delivery sectorThe government said the partnership with Swiggy would help take the National Career Service portal deeper into the gig economy space.

How Niu Gensheng, China's dairy tycoon, rose from poverty to prosperityNiu Gensheng was born into a poor family in Inner Mongolia. His parents couldn't afford to raise him, so they sold him to a cattle farmer. The farmer adopted him, but life was still full of challenges.

Retail inflation eases further to 3.34% in March, lowest since August 2019The March CPI inflation print came in below February's 3.61%, marking the second straight month that inflation has stayed under the Reserve Bank of India's 4% medium-term target.

Hermes overtakes LVMH in market value years after takeover dramaWay back in 2010, LVMH's billionaire CEO Bernard Arnault shocked the corporate world by acquiring a huge stake in Hermes. It was seen as an effort to seize control of the company. But the Hermes family fought back. They came together to defend their brand and ultimately made Arnault sell his shares.

Sensex gains nearly 1,600 points, Nifty above 23,300; IndusInd bank gains 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 1,577.63 points to close at 76,734.89, while the NSE Nifty50 added 500 points to end at 23,328.55.

Dalal Street dusts off Trump's April 2 tariff shock, stages full comebackTrading resumed after a long weekend, but there was no slowdown in terms of momentum. The Nifty50 climbed as much as 2.4% intraday, comfortably reclaiming its pre-tariff territory, while the Sensex gained over 1,600 points.

UPS vs NPS: Which pension scheme should you opt forThe Unified Pension Scheme is the new retirement scheme effective from April 1, 2025. It is for central government employees. If you're currently under NPS, you'll have the option to shift to this new plan.

This multibagger stock has given 13,000% return. Should you buy?Since its stock market debut on July 28, 2003, the company has delivered a return of nearly 12,951.78%. It touched its 52-week high of Rs 2,559.95 on September 4, 2024.

Adani Green share price jumps 5% today after Q4 business update. Check detailsThe stock rose as much as 5.33% in early trade to hit Rs 941.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 1:05 pm, the shares of the company were trading 4.17% higher at Rs 931.

USD vs INR: CA explains which one actually holds more valueCA Nitin Kaushik said that some people argue that salaries in India grow faster. Though he doesn't deny it, he questions whether that trend still holds true today.

Sensex, Nifty jump 6% in two sessions. Are Dalal Street bulls back on track?While the sharp rebound in equity markets has reignited investor enthusiasm, experts are urging caution amid ongoing global uncertainties, especially around the US trade policy.

'Rich Dad Poor Dad' author warns of giant market crash, bets on gold and BitcoinAccording to Robert Kiyosaki the rising gold, silver, and Bitcoin prices show that traditional ways of saving—like stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and ETFs—are no longer safe.

Should you buy HAL, BEL, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks? Check price targetDefence companies are expected to do well for many positive reasons. These include higher government spending on defence, tensions between countries, a longer list of defence products being made in India, etc.

Explained: Why HDFC share price surged 4% today and what next?HDFC Bank's share price rose as the country's largest private lender, along with several other banks, cut its deposit interest rate by 25 basis points.

IndusInd Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI: Why banking stocks are rising todayShares of IndusInd Bank gained above 6% on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), while HDFC Bank was up 3.3%. Axis Bank shares rose nearly 3% and ICICI Bank was up 2.3%.
Markets in green amid Trump's tariff rowStock market benchmark indices surged on Tuesday as trading resumed following a long weekend, with auto sector stocks leading the gains.

Is Quess Corp share price down over 50%? Not quite, here's what happenedWhat investors are seeing now is the adjusted market value of Quess Corp after the spin-off. The value of the new entities will be discovered once they are listed on the stock exchanges in the coming weeks.

Tata Motors, M&M, Maruti: Why are auto stocks gaining today?Tata Motors led the pack with a gain of over 5%, while Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) climbed nearly 4%. Maruti Suzuki advanced close to 2%, and other prominent names such as Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto, and Ashok Leyland rose over 1.5%.

Sensex, Nifty rally 2% in early trade. 5 things investors need to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tata Motors led the gains on the Sensex, jumping 5.03% in early trade. Other auto stocks such as Mahindra & Mahindra also performed well, rising 3.74%.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market gain amid positive global cues?Stock market today: Trading on Dalal Street remained shut on Monday due to Ambedkar Jayanti. As trading resumes, investors are hopeful that the markets will continue their positive trend from Friday, when both Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 2%.

Stocks to watch on April 15: Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDAKey stocks to watch on April 15 are shares of Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDA ICICI Lombard, ICICI Pru Life, among others, due to varied news developments and Q4 results.

entertainment.headline: Vijay Sethupathi reflects on working with director Puri JagannadhVijay Sethupathi recently shared his excitement about collaborating with director Puri Jagannadh. On being asked about the collaboration, he said it was the story that convinced him, not the filmmaker's past track record.
Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze to host Emmys 2025Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze will host the 77th Emmy Awards, live from Los Angeles. The event will take place on September 15 IST.

Citadel spin-offs cancelled, to merge storylines into main seriesPrime Video has decided not to continue with 'Citadel' spinoffs 'Honey Bunny' and 'Diana' as standalone series. Instead, their storylines will be integrated into the second season of 'Citadel', set for a global release in 2026.

Lebanon bans Disney's Snow White over Gal Gadot's support for IsraelLebanon has prohibited the screening of Disney's 'Snow White' due to the casting of Israeli actor Gal Gadot. The ban aligns with the country's ongoing boycott of Israeli artists amid regional tensions.

Actor Nazriya Nazim Fahadh 'struggling with emotional well-being': I shut downNazriya Nazim Fahadh opened up about her recent absence from the public eye, explaining that it was due to struggles with emotional well-being. She also extended her apologies and gratitude to her friends and supporters.

Pooja Hegde on break from Telugu films: Felt like a missing childPooja Hegde recently talked about why she has stayed away from Telugu films. She also spoke about her upcoming projects, and her return to Tollywood.

SS Rajamouli recalls Jr NTR's Komuram Bheemudo shoot in RRR: Tarak was possessed'RRR' director SS Rajamouli, who was in Japan to promote his Netflix documentary 'RRR: Behind and Beyond', praised Jr NTR's performance in the song 'Komuram Bheemudo', while interacting with the media.

Rohit Shetty, John Abraham join hands for Rakesh Maria's biopicJohn Abraham and Rohit Shetty are joining hands for a new film inspired by Rakesh Maria's life. The project will explore Maria's illustrious career in the Mumbai Police.

Radhika Apte to join Tabu and Vijay Sethupathi in Puri Jagannadh's next: ReportAfter years away from Telugu cinema, Radhika Apte is reportedly reuniting with filmmaker Puri Jagannadh for an intense pan-India project, also starring Vijay Sethupathi and Tabu.

Eddington teaser: Joaquin Phoenix, Pedro Pascal clash in Ari Aster's black comedyThe teaser of Ari Aster's latest film, 'Eddington', released on April 15. A black comedy, Eddington is set to premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival.

How Nidhhi Agerwal transformed into a princess for Hari Hara Veera MalluTelugu-Tamil star Nidhhi Agerwal gears up for two major releases with Pawan Kalyan and Prabhas. In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, she spoke about 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu', working with the two stars and more.

Kannada superstar Upendra explains how Coolie co-star Rajinikanth inspired himKannada actor-director Upendra, while interacting with the media at a press meet held in Hyderabad to promote his upcoming Kannada film '45', spoke about how he considered himself blessed to have had the opportunity to work with him.

Tamannaah on 'milky beauty' tag: I don't want to play the victimTamannaah Bhatia, during the promotion of her upcoming supernatural thriller, 'Odela 2', remarked that she does not want to "be in a victim-mode".

The Patriotism pattern: Why Akshay Kumar keeps returning to nationalist rolesAkshay Kumar returns to his patriotic roots with 'Kesari Chapter 2', portraying the role of C Sankaran Nair in a courtroom drama set against the backdrop of the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. Known for his consistent portrayal of nationalistic themes, Akshay remains Bollywood's go-to figure for films that resonate with Indian pride.

Gene Hackman's wife Googled flu symptoms days before death: ReportAuthorities have revealed that Gene Hackman, 95, and his wife Betsy Arakawa, 65, died in their Santa Fe home from natural causes—Arakawa from rare hantavirus and Hackman from heart disease worsened by Alzheimer's. New details shed light on Arakawa's health concerns before her death and confirm no foul play was involved.

Jaideep Ahlawat offered Vibhishan's role in Ranbir's Ramayana? Here's the truthRanbir Kapoor's 'Ramayana' is one of the most anticipated projects in Bollywood. It was reported that actor Jaideep Ahlawat was offered the role of Vibhishan in the Nitesh Tiwari directorial. However, India Today Digital's source dismissed the report.

Babil on trolling for humility: It hurt when they got Baba involved | ExclusiveBabil Khan, son of the late actor Irrfan, often faces online trolling, with the video of him apologising to an actor for photobombing during a red carpet going viral. In an exclusive interview, he shared that lit hurt him one time when his father was also brought into the meme.

Jesse Eisenberg's starry musical film begins productionJesse Eisenberg's musical film, featuring Julianne Moore and Paul Giamatti, is now in production. Halle Bailey, Bernadette Peters, and Havana Rose Liu have also recently joined the cast.

Kichcha Sudeep's BRB: First Blood shoot starts, calls it unparalleled excitementKannada actor Kichcha Sudeep shared the news on X, about his highly anticipated upcoming film, 
Billa Ranga Basha: First Blood', directed by Anup Bhandari. The film is going on floors on April 16.

general news.headline: Undoing 'waqf by user' will have huge consequences: Top court's big remarksThe Supreme Court, hearing 73 petitions challenging the Waqf Amendment Act, said that denotifying the properties of the 'waqf by user', would have huge consequences, but stopped short of passing interim orders.

JD Vance's India visit: Meeting with PM, trip to Jaipur, Agra on the cardsDuring the India visit, JD Vance will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi and will also make trips to key cultural sites such as Jaipur and Agra.

Rishikesh-Karnaprayag rail project: India's longest transport tunnel takes shapeThe tunnel is part of the ambitious Rishikesh-Karnaprayag broad gauge railway line, a crucial project aimed at boosting connectivity in Uttarakhand.

Visa revoked, Indian student sues Trump administration over deportation threatThe development comes at a time when the Trump administration has started revoking visas of hundreds of international students over alleged campus activism.

Madame Tussaud: How a French Revolution survivor turned beheadings into businessMadame Tussauds, now a global wax museum brand, has its roots in the French Revolution, where Marie Tussaud crafted death masks of guillotined figures. She died on April 16, 1850 -- 135 years ago today. Here's the chilling history behind the wax.

Delhi Capitals reclaim top spot after last-over thriller vs RoyalsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Delhi Capitals edged past Rajasthan Royals in a thriller after the match on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi went right down to the Super Over.

US giant fires 200, mostly Telugus, over salary fraudUS mortgage giant, Fannie Mae, has laid off 200 employees, mostly Telugus, over salary fraud, according to a report. The employees allegedly misused the company's matching gift programme by collaborating with Telugu associations. An Indian-American Congressman has sought the company's response on the mass lay-offs.

Cheap stunt: Farooq Abdullah on ex-R&AW chief's Article 370 abrogation claimFormer R&AW chief AS Dulat claimed that former J&K chief minister Farooq Abdullah 'privately backed' the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019.

Woman drowns in Ganga at Uttarkashi's Manikarnika Ghat while recording videoA horrifying video of a woman being swept away in the strong currents of the Ganga river at Uttarkashi's Manikarnika Ghat has gone viral on social media.

How Tejashwi gave Rahul, Kharge a Bihar poll reality checkIn 2020, the Congress contested a disproportionate number of seats, winning under a third of them and denying the RJD-led alliance a shot at power. Will 2025 be different?

Runaway mother explains why she eloped with her daughter's fiancé in UPA woman who eloped with her daughter's fiance, returned on Wednesday and explained reasons for the move. She alleged that she faced constant abuse from her husband.

Zuckerberg tried to avoid antitrust case trial with $450 million settlement: ReportMark Zuckerberg's Meta is facing an antitrust case over its high-profile acquisitions of Instagram and WhatsApp. Days before the case went to trial, Zuckerberg tried to settle the case for USD 450 million, as per a report.

Actor Nazriya Nazim Fahadh 'struggling with emotional well-being': I shut downNazriya Nazim Fahadh opened up about her recent absence from the public eye, explaining that it was due to struggles with emotional well-being. She also extended her apologies and gratitude to her friends and supporters.

Why jails in India are asking to be freedOver half of India's prisons are overcrowded, with 176 of them housing four times the number of inmates they were sanctioned to hold. Two prisons in Delhi's Tihar Jail have 400% occupancy. India's jails are bursting at the seams even as the proportion of undertrial inmates rises to 76% of all prisoners.

Mr Dog makes Indian-origin man smuggle puppy into Singapore, lands him in jailAn Indian-origin Malaysian, Mahentharan Ganesan, has been sentenced to jail and fined by a Singapore court. Driven by debt, Ganesan had accepted the offer of an animal-smuggling kingpin called Mr Dog. Ganesan smuggled cats and dogs into Singapore in laundry bags, until a Labrador pup exposed him.

Rohit Sharma to captain in England Tests? India star drops hint in latest podcastIndia tour of England 2025: Captain Rohit Sharma said India are hopeful of a strong showing in the Old Blighty. While speculation around his Test future continues, the skipper appears to be already planning for the five-Test series starting June 20.

Low vitamin D affecting your sex life? New study links it to erectile dysfunctionVitamin D deficiency may cause erectile dysfunction by impairing blood flow and reducing drug effectiveness, a new study revealed.

Will you allow Muslims on Hindu boards? Supreme Court questions Waqf compositionThe Chief Justice pointed out that as per the Act, eight members of the board are Muslims, and possibly only two are not. "Why not have Muslims also on the advisory board of Hindu endowments then?" he said.

Spotify down: Company says reports about it being security hack are falseMusic streaming app Spotify is facing a global outage affecting thousands of users worldwide. There were reports alleging that the outage was caused by a security hack but the company says the reports are "false".

Justice BR Gavai likely to succeed Sanjiv Khanna as next Chief Justice of IndiaJustice BR Gavai, if appointed, will become the 52nd Chief Justice of India. He is likely to take the oath of the top judicial chair on May 14.
Why prolonged, loud use of earbuds damages hearingEarbuds are high on style and convenience, but how to ensure they don't cause hearing loss?

Trump calls Harvard a joke, says it has been hiring all woke teaching staffUS President Donald Trump ramped up his attacks on Harvard, claiming that the university "lost its way" and was no longer considered a "decent place" for learning.

Minor stripped, filmed by mother, her partner over disclosing their affairA minor girl was allegedly stripped and filmed by her mother and her mother's boyfriend because she disclosed their extramarital affair to the landlord.

White House fact sheet sparks confusion about 245% tariff on ChinaWhile a White House fact sheet mentions that China now faces up to 245% tariffs, the usual brouhaha by Donald Trump while making such announcements was missing.

sports.headline: Delhi Capitals reclaim top spot after last-over thriller vs RoyalsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Delhi Capitals edged past Rajasthan Royals in a thriller after the match on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi went right down to the Super Over.

IPL 2025: Parag uses same bat after umpire struggles to pass it through gaugeRajasthan Royals (RR) batter Riyan Parag's bat failed to pass through the measuring gauge against Delhi Capitals (DC) during Match 32 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). However, he was still allowed to use it during his innings.

Sanju Samson walks off retired hurt in major injury scare for RRIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Sanju Samson faced discomfort while batting in the match against Delhi Capitals and had to retire hurt after scoring 31 runs off 19 balls with two fours and three sixes.

Watch: MS Dhoni collabs with Lionel Messi in new ad, shows off football skillsLegendary India cricketer MS Dhoni was seen collaborating with football icon Lionel Messi in a new advertisement where the duo were seen showing off their football skills.

Noor has the potential to lead Afghanistan's spin attack: Ex-India spinnerIPL 2025: Former Indian off-spinner Sarandeep Singh said that Noor Ahmad has bowled brilliantly in the ongoing tournament and could on to become the lead spinner of the Afghanistan team in the future.

Wish they checked bats, when I was playing: Daniel Vettori's hilarious takeSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) head coach Daniel Vettori made a hilarious comment on frequent bat checks in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

IPL 2025: Karun Nair seen frustrated in dressing room after three-ball duck vs RRDelhi Capitals' (DC) Karun Nair seemed frustrated in the dressing room after getting out for three-ball duck against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in Match 32 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Want to end my career on a high: Shakib desires to make Bangladesh comebackBangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan hasn't given up hope on his return to the national team after clearing his test for suspect bowling action. Shakib last played for the Tigers in the Kanpur Test against India.

Karun Nair recalls brutal Jasprit Bumrah assault: Had complete freedom to go for itIPL 2025: Delhi Capitals star Karun Nair recalled his aggressive approach against Jasprit Bumrah, saying he did not plan in advance to take on the world's best fast bowler. Despite Nair's 40-ball 89, Delhi failed to chase 202 against the Mumbai Indians.

Rohit Sharma to captain in England Tests? India star drops hint in latest podcastIndia tour of England 2025: Captain Rohit Sharma said India are hopeful of a strong showing in the Old Blighty. While speculation around his Test future continues, the skipper appears to be already planning for the five-Test series starting June 20.

Despite Nair's 40-ball 89, Delhi failed to chase 202 against the Mumbai Indians.

Rohit Sharma to captain in England Tests? India star drops hint in latest podcastIndia tour of England 2025: Captain Rohit Sharma said India are hopeful of a strong showing in the Old Blighty. While speculation around his Test future continues, the skipper appears to be already planning for the five-Test series starting June 20.

Ricky Ponting reveals how PBKS plotted Sunil Narine's dismissal vs KKRPunjab Kings' (PBKS) head coach Ricky Ponting revealed how they plotted Sunil Narine's dismissal against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in Match 31 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

NBA Play-in tournament preview: Mavericks vs Kings, Heat vs Bulls, schedule, how to watch & moreThe 2025 NBA Play-in tournament has begun. Two important matchups are set for Wednesday night, April 16. In the Western Conference, the Dallas Mavericks will face off against the Sacramento Kings in a win-or-go-home battle. While, the Chicago Bulls take on the Miami Heat in the Eastern Conference.

Jitesh Sharma enjoying finisher's role at RCB: Scores of 20,30 are my fiftiesJitesh Sharma revealed that he's enjoying finisher's role at the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) and the scores of 20 and 30 are his new milestones.

NBA Playoffs: Los Angeles Lakers roster decided, full schedule and key matchup previewThe Los Angeles Lakers have officially finalized their roster heading into the 2025 NBA Playoffs. The Lakers finished the regular season with a strong 50-32 record and earned the No. 3 seed in the Western Conference.

That's a Batman, Jimmy Butler hails Stephen Curry as Warriors clinch Playoff spotIn a Western Conference NBA Play-in tournament matchup at Chase Centre on Tuesday, April 15, the Golden State Warriors survived a second-half comeback from the Memphis Grizzlies to claim a 121-116 victory and lock in the No. 7 seed for the NBA postseason.

Real Madrid vs Arsenal, UCL quarter-final 2nd leg: When and where to watchReal Madrid are known for historic Champions League turnarounds, and their clash against Arsenal at the Bernabeu is set up perfectly for another. But the Gunners, fresh off a first-leg thrashing, will look to spoil the party with composure.

Rohit Sharma backs ODI cricket's future: It has a different challengeRohit Sharma opened up about his enduring love for ODI cricket, underlining its unique challenge and long-standing importance, even amid the T20 frenzy. The India captain's Champions Trophy heroics only cemented his legacy in the 50-over format.

How coach Gambhir reacted when Rohit Sharma dropped himself from Sydney TestSpeaking to Michael Clarke on a recent podcast, Rohit Sharma recalled his decision to sit out of the fifth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney. The India captain discussed a conversation with coach Gautam Gambhir before making the big call.

That's a Batman, Jimmy Butler hails Stephen Curry as Warriors clinch Playoff spotIn a Western Conference NBA Play-in tournament matchup at Chase Centre on Tuesday, April 15, the Golden State Warriors survived a second-half comeback from the Memphis Grizzlies to claim a 121-116 victory and lock in the No. 7 seed for the NBA postseason.

Real Madrid vs Arsenal, UCL quarter-final 2nd leg: When and where to watchReal Madrid are known for historic Champions League turnarounds, and their clash against Arsenal at the Bernabeu is set up perfectly for another. But the Gunners, fresh off a first-leg thrashing, will look to spoil the party with composure.

Rohit Sharma backs ODI cricket's future: It has a different challengeRohit Sharma opened up about his enduring love for ODI cricket, underlining its unique challenge and long-standing importance, even amid the T20 frenzy. The India captain's Champions Trophy heroics only cemented his legacy in the 50-over format.

How coach Gambhir reacted when Rohit Sharma dropped himself from Sydney TestSpeaking to Michael Clarke on a recent podcast, Rohit Sharma recalled his decision to sit out of the fifth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney. The India captain discussed a conversation with coach Gautam Gambhir before making the big call.

Want me to say something silly? England star gives his take on IPL vs PSL debateEngland batter Sam Billings said the Indian Premier League is well ahead of the rest of the T20 leagues in the world. Billings has been playing for Lahore Qalandars in the 10th edition of the Pakistan Super League.

DC vs RR, Match preview: Can Delhi snap back against recovering Rajasthan?IPL 2025, DC vs RR Match Preview: Delhi Capitals will aim to return to winning ways after their unbeaten streak was snapped by Mumbai. Against a struggling Rajasthan Royals outfit, the Axar Patel-led side may look to experiment and regain control atop the IPL 2025 points table.

MS Dhoni 'greatest reader of the game': Dube's Bishnoi revelation thrills fansIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: Shivam Dube, speaking to the Super Kings, revealed that MS Dhoni had predicted Rishabh Pant would not use Ravi Bishnoi as long as the big-hitting left-hander stayed in the middle during their chase of 167. Dhoni and Dube anchored a successful chase for CSK in Lucknow on Monday, April 14.

Watch: Sunil Narine's bat fails size test during KKR's shock loss to PBKS in IPL 2025IPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders stars Sunil Narine and Anrich Nortje failed the mandatory bat size checks during their defeat to Punjab Kings in Mullanpur on Tuesday, April 15.

IPL 2025: Fit-again Mayank Yadav joins LSG squad, likely to play against RRMayank Yadav is back in Lucknow Super Giants camp ahead of their key clash against Rajasthan Royals. The speedster, returning from injury, could be the answer to the franchise's bowling struggles as they seek to solidify their playoff push in IPL 2025.

PSG, Villa players hold back laughs as Europa anthem played before CL clashA Europa League anthem blunder set a bizarre tone for Aston Villa's Champions League clash with PSG, leaving players holding back laughter. But once the whistle blew, Villa brought intensity, forcing PSG to dig deep to survive the quarter-final.

NBA Play-in tournament: Warriors defeat Grizzlies in 121-116 thriller behind Curry, ButlerThe Golden State Warriors edged out the Memphis Grizzlies in a thriller 121-116 victory in an NBA Play-in tournament showdown on Tuesday, April 15 at Chase Center.

Making Riyan Parag RR stand-in captain over me was correct call: Nitish RanaNitish Rana said he had no issues with RR appointing Riyan Parag, the stand-in skipper, over him while Sanju Samson was recovering from injury. Riyan captained the Royals during the first 3 games of the season.

Barcelona, PSG reach semis after surviving Villa, Dortmund comebackFC Barcelona and PSG narrowly escaped Champions League heartbreak as Dortmund and Aston Villa threatened major comebacks in two dramatic second-leg encounters. A Guirassy hat-trick and a Villa fightback made it close, but the giants held on—just.

Rahane blames lack of clarity with Angkrish for review horror in PBKS vs KKRAjinkya Rahane blamed lack of clarity for the review horror during the PBKS vs KKR game. Rahane said that the communication with Angkrish Raghuvanshi wasn't clear enough in the end.

Nehal Wadhera praises Yuzvendra Chahal masterclass after PBKS stun KKRPunjab Kings batter Nehal Wadhera praised Yuzvendra Chahal's match-winning effort with the ball against Kolkata Knight Riders in IPL 2025. Chahal turned the match around with a brilliant bowling session, capturing four key wickets to help PBKS defeat KKK by 16 runs.

Rahane admits 'collective failure' after KKR fail to chase 112 vs PBKSKolkata Knight Riders captain Ajinkya Rahane described his team's 16-run loss against Punjab Kings as a "collective batting failure" after a spectacular collapse on Tuesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
